The picture on the front cover is quite attractive, happy to read this and =
congrats! 


     On Thursday, 14 May 2015, 7:11, "Ryan Hall ryanhallcs@gma=
il.com [neat]" <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
   

 =C2=A0   Excited to read=
 this - congrats to you both!
On Tue, May 12, 2015 at 9:48 AM, Jeff Clune j=
clune@... [neat] <neat@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

 =C2=A0   A huge cong=
ratulations to Ken and Joel for this book coming out!


Best regards,
Jeff =
Clune

Assistant Professor,=C2=A0Computer ScienceDirector,=C2=A0Evolving Ar=
tificial Intelligence LabUniversity of Wyoming
jeffclune@...
jeffclune=
.com

On May 11, 2015, at 11:05 PM, kstanley@... [neat] <neat@yah=
oogroups.com> wrote:
 =C2=A0 Joel Lehman and I are pleased to announce the =
publication of our new book by Springer:

Why Greatness Cannot Be Planned: =
The Myth of the Objective

You can get it at Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/=
Why-Greatness-Cannot-Planned-Objective/dp/3319155237=C2=A0 
Or through Spri=
nger: http://www.springer.com/us/book/9783319155234

As some of you know, J=
oel and I have long thought that the implications of novelty search and non=
-objective thinking in general extend far beyond only machine learning and =
evolutionary computation.=C2=A0 From the way we as a society encourage inno=
vation to the interpretation of evolution in nature, the implications of th=
e objective paradox touch an enormous breadth of domains, including of cour=
se the now-familiar algorithmic insights.=C2=A0 Our new book finally gives =
us the chance to weave all these disparate threads together into a single u=
nified perspective.=C2=A0 As a rare example of algorithmic insights from AI=
 leading to a broader social and cultural critique, we hope you will find i=
ts message inspiring and thought-provoking. =C2=A0 Of course we're always h=
appy to hear your thoughts as well. 

Here's the cover:
 =C2=A0



Best,
Ke=
n and Joel

er.com/us/book/9783319155234</a><br clear=3D"none"><br clear=3D"none">As so=

mplications of the objective paradox touch an enormous breadth of domains, =
including of course the now-familiar algorithmic insights.  Our new bo=
